intro: Gilia tenuiflora var. genuina, commonly known as the narrow-flowered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or red, which bloom in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to arid conditions. Gilia tenuiflora var. genuina is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
